block.p: Meredith Cori Bloch and Corry Alexander Prohens were married last evening at the New York Palace Hotel. Cantor David Benedict officiated.

Mrs. Prohens, 25, is a special-education teacher at the Locust Valley (N.Y.) Middle School. She graduated from the State University College at Oneonta, N.Y., and received a master's degree in special education from Columbia University. She is a daughter of Randee and Brian Bloch of Roslyn Heights, N.Y. Her mother is an associate director of the foundation supporting the North Shore/Long Island Jewish Health System in Manhasset, N.Y. The bride's father is a senior account executive at City Sprint, a messenger service in Manhattan.
Meredith Cori Bloch and Corry Alexander Prohens were married last evening at the New York Palace Hotel. Cantor David Benedict officiated.

Mrs. Prohens, 25, is a special-education teacher at the Locust Valley (N.Y.) Middle School. She graduated from the State University College at Oneonta, N.Y., and received a master's degree in special education from Columbia University. She is a daughter of Randee and Brian Bloch of Roslyn Heights, N.Y. Her mother is an associate director of the foundation supporting the North Shore/Long Island Jewish Health System in Manhasset, N.Y. The bride's father is a senior account executive at City Sprint, a messenger service in Manhattan.

Mr. Prohens, 27, is the founder and chief executive of two New York companies: Venture Resources, a recruitment company for technology executives, and the Insight Technology Solutions Corporation, a technology consulting concern. He graduated magna cum laude from Hofstra University. He is a son of Nancy and Edward Prohens of New Hyde Park, N.Y. His mother is a skin care specialist at the Cresera Wellness Center, in Williston Park, N.Y. His father is the chief executive of the Cameo Group, which runs employment agencies in New York.
